And that he or they haue then been by the ſpace of one yere nexte before the takyng of the ſayd othe more conuerſaunt and dwellyng in any one of the ſame places where he or they ſhal ſo happen to be ſet or preſented then in the other: that then the partie of parties ſo ſet or preſented in two or mo places then one, and ſo takyng his othe without any other plee in writyng, ſhalbe clerely diſcharged againſt the kyng, his heyres & ſucceſſours or euery of the ſayd aſſeſementes and preſentmentes, ſauyng onely of the aſſeſement and preſentment in the place where he or they was or were moſte conuerſaunt & dwellyng as is before ſayd.

And be it alſo enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that the Barons of the kynges Exchequer or two of theim for the tyme beyng, ſhal not onely haue full power & aucthoritie to receiue and take the othe of ſuche partie or parties as ſhalbe ſo ſet or preſented in any mo places then one, but ſhall alſo vpon the ſame othe or othes ſo taken, diſcharge the partie & parties of all ſuche ſummes of money as he or they ſhould bee in any wiſe charged with, ſauyng onely of ſuche ſummes of money as the ſame partie or parties were ſo ſeſſed at in ſuche place and places where he or they were moſt conuerſaunt and dwellyng as is aforeſayd.

And to the intent the kynges maieſtie may be truly & iuſtly anſwered of the ſayd relief of the polle of ſhepe before by vs graūted to his highnes: be it ordained and enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that yerely duryng theſayd iii. yeres before the firſt day of May, there ſhalbe a Cō miſſion with ten cedules containyng in them the tenor of this acte to be annexed to ſuche commiſſion directed vnder the kynges great ſeale of England into euery coūtie, ſhyre, ridyng, citie, borough, toune corporat, and the Iſle of Wight, and into all and euery other place within this realme and other the kynges dominions that is or ſhalbe chargeable to the paiment of the ſayd Relief of the polle of ſhepe to ſuche perſones as the ſame yere before were Commiſſioners for the aſſeſement and taxaciō of the value of euery perſons goodes and ſubſtaunce, in the ſame ſhire
or other place, or to as many of them as ſhalbe then liuyng, and to ſuche other perſones as the ſayd lorde Chauncelor and other with him before named ſhall name and appoinct. By the whiche commiſſion the Commiſſioners ſhal haue full power and aucthoritie to enquire by the othes of the Perſon, Vicar or curate, & iiii. or as many honeſt perſons of euery pariſh, village, and hamlet within the limittes of their cōmiſſion, wherof the Conſtable, Tithyngman or Borſolder ſhalbe one, if any Conſtable, Tithyngman or Borſolder be dwellyng in the ſame pariſhe, village or Hamlet, and by the othes of as many other honeſt & diſcrete perſons as they ſhall thynke cōuenient, or otherwiſe by ſuche meanes and pollicies as they ſhal thynke beſt, wherby the truth may appeare of the nomber and natures of all and ſynguler ſheepe beyng within the limittes of their commiſſion, whoſe they be, in what toune or pariſh the owner dwelleth, and of what ſtate or degree he is, and whether for the moſte part of the yere they be kept in ſeuerall paſtures, or ſeuerall marſhes, or in commons, or groundes commonly vſed to be tylled: the tenor of whiche othe hereafter foloweth.

¶ Ye ſhall diligently enquire and iuſtly and truly preſent and certifie vs the kynges Commſſioners what nomber of Ewes, Wethers & other ſhere ſhepe be within the limittes of your charge, whoſe they be, in what toune or pariſhe the owner dwelleth, of what condicion and degre he is, & whether for the moſte part of the yere they be kept in ſeuerall paſtures or ſeueral Marſhes, or in cōmons or groūdes comenly vſed to be tylled, as ye truſt to be ſaued by the merites of Chriſtes paſſion.

And it is alſo ordained and enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that yerely duryng the ſayd thre yeres, on the Tueſdaye after the feaſt of the Natiuitie of ſainct Ihon Baptiſt, there ſhalbe a generall ſuruay made, of all and ſinguler ſhepe, in euery pariſh, village and other place within this realme, the Iſle of Wight & other the kynges dominions chargeable to the payment of this Relief of ſheepe, by ſuche perſones as ſhalbe appointed & ſworne to do the ſame in maner and fourme before reherſed. And that vpon ſuche ſuruay, euery ſhepe ſhalbe taken for a ſhere ſhepe that is at the tyme of the ſuruay of the age of one yere or more, albeit the ſame ſhepe be not at that tyme ſhorne.

And it is further ordained and enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that if any parſon to the intent to defraude the execucion of this ſtatute ſhall remoue the ſayd daye of ſuruay his ſheepe before the ſuruay taken from the vſual place where thei were comonly kept for the moſte part of the yere, or els ſhall cauſe them or any part of them to be conueyed to any other place whereby they ſhall not be ſuruayed, or whereby the kyng ſhall loſe any part of the Relief to him geuen by this ſtatute, that euery perſon ſo offēdyng ſhall forfaite and loſe to the kynges Maieſtie, treble ſo muche as he ought to pay by vertue of this ſtatute.

And it is alſo ordayned & enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that if any perſon ſommoned to appeare before the ſayd cōmiſſioners, do make
defaulte hauyng no reaſonable excuſe: or appearyng, ſhal refuſe to take the ſayd othe, or takyng the ſayd othe ſhal not diligently attend and endeuour the execucion therof, or ſhall not appeare and make preſentment before the ſayd Cōmiſſioners at ſuche tyme & place as he ſhalbe appointed, that euery perſon ſo offendyng for euery ſuche default ſhal forfayte and loſe to the kynges Maieſtie xl. s̄.

And it is alſo ordayned and enacted by thaucthoritie aforeſayd, that yerely duryng the ſayd thre yeres within one moneth next after the ſuruay of ſhepe, and the preſentmentes made by the viewers of the ſheepe in maner and forme as is before declared, the Commiſſioners in euery ſhire or other place ſhal all or the moſt part aſſemble them ſelues together, and conferre the preſentmētes made before them of the ſhepe, with the preſentmentes before made of the value of the goodes & ſubſtaunce of all perſones within the limittes of their commiſſion. And that vpon ſuche collacions of the preſentmentes if it ſhal appeare vnto them that any perſon is chargeable by vertue of this acte to paye for the polle of his ſhepe whiche before was not charged for his goodes. Or that if any perſon within the limittes of their cōmiſſion be chargeable to pay more after the rate of the polle of his ſhepe preſēted before them, then he was before for the value of his ſubſtaunce of his goodes, the ſaid Cōmiſſioners or the more part of them as they ſhalbe deuided, ſhall within one moneth next after ſuche aſſemble by their writynges indented to be ſigned and ſealed by them, make furth extreates of all & ſinguler ſūmes of money that any perſon ought to paye for the rate of ye polle of his ſhepe not beeyng before charged with his goodes, or for the ouerplus that any perſon ought to pay for that the rate of the polle of his ſheepe doeth ſurmount the paiment before made of ye value of his goodes, & theſame writynges ſhal not onely deliuer vnto ſufficient and ſubſtanciall inhabitantes, Conſtables, Subconſtables and other officers and perſones ioyntely of hundredes, tounes, pariſhes, and other places within the limittes where the owners dwel or haue their moſte vſual abidyng, to be leuied, gathered, and receiued of the owner of ſuche ſheepe or his executours or adminiſtratours, but alſo ſhall in like maner deliuer the like writyng to the high Collectour of the ſame limit, to charge him with the receipt therof of the Subcollectour or Subcollectours, & the payment therof at the kynges receipte. And that the ſayd Subcollectours, and Commiſſioners, ſhall not onely haue for their labours vi. d. of euery pound, commyng, growyng and to bee payed to the kynges Maieſtie for the Relief of the polle of the ſheepe by vertue of this acte, but alſo that they and euery of them ſhall haue the like power and auctoritie to gather and leuy theſame, and all fynes and forfaytures commyng and growyng for the execucion and gatheryng of this Relief of the polle of ſhepe by ſuche like waies and meanes as before in this act be limitted & appointed for the leuiyng and gatheryng of the Relief of goodes. And that the ſayd Cōmiſſioners, Collectours and all and euery other perſon
and perſons ſhall behaue, ordre, and vſe themſelues in all & euery thyng concernyng thexecucion of this part of the ſtatute touchyng the leuiyng and gatheryng of the relief of the polle of the ſhepe, as before in this act is limitted & appointed for to do touching the Relief of the goodes vpō like paynes, penalties & forfaitures as be before declared in this acte.

Prouided alwayes and be it ordained and enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd that al & ſinguler ſummes of money due to the kynges Maieſtie of this Relief of the polle of ſhepe, ſhalbe gathered by the Subcollectour or high collectour of the limittes where the owner dwelleth and none other place.

And it is further ordayned and enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that the ſayd Cōmiſſioners for the ſuruay of the nombre and value of the ſhepe ſhal yerely duryng theſayd thre yeres make returne and certificat vnto the kynges Exchequier before the x. day of October aſwel of the count •• parte of al and euery extreates deliuered by them to the high Collectours, as alſo of all and ſinguler preſentmentes made before thē, and of all & ſinguler their procedynges concernyng the ſayd cōmiſſion. And that in the ende of all and euery their certificats they ſhall make ſpecial remembraūces and declaracions of all and ſinguler perſons not dwellyng within the limittes of their cōmiſſion, that haue ſheepe within the limittes of theſame commiſſion, where ſuche perſons dwel, & of what ſtate and degree they be, what nombre, and what kynde of ſhepe they be, and in what groūdes for the moſt part of the yere they be kept. And that vpon ſuche returne and certificat of the commiſſion to be made by the Commiſſioners for the ſuruay of ſhepe beyng conferred with the bokes of the taxation and value of the ſubſtaunce or euery perſon, if it ſhal appeare that the kynges Maieſtie ought to haue more by any meanes toward the ſayd Relief then before was payed or payable, that then vpon an extreate therof to be made out of the ſayd court of the Exchequier to the high collectour of the place where the partie that ought to pay more dwelleth, theſame Collectour ſhalbe therwith charged, & ſhall gather & leuy theſame in like maner and fourme as he ought to do the reſt of his Collections.

And to thintent the kynges Maieſtie may be iuſtly anſwered for the Relief by vs before graunted of the price and value of all clothes: be it ordayned and enacted, that the Commiſſioners to be appointed for the taxacion of the Relief of the ſubſtaunce of euery perſon, ſhall haue full power and aucthoritie by vertue of this acte, and of their commiſſion, as they ſhalbe deuided, to name, conſtitute, and appoint, in euery Citie, Borough, Toune, Hundred and pariſhe, within the limittes of their deuiſions by their diſcrecions, ſuche and ſo many honeſt, ſubſtancial, and diſcrete menne, to be praiſers of the ſayd clothes, chargeable to the payment
of this Relief of clothes, as they ſhall thinke conuenient & neceſſary, & them from tyme to tyme to alter & put newe in their places as they ſhall haue occaſion. And that theſayd prayſers before they take vpon them the appraiſement of ſuche clothes, ſhalbe ſworne in maner & forme folowyng.

¶ Ye ſhal faythfully and truely eſteme and ſet the iuſt pryce & value of all ſuche clothes as ſhalbe brought vnto you to be viewed and prayſed, as ye ſhal in your cōſciences thynke theſame worth to be ſolde when they ſhalbe wrought, and theſame ſhall not ſuffer to be deliuered out of your cuſtody, tyl ye haue made of the colour, kynde and pryce therof an entry both in the boke of the clothier and alſo of the Aulnageour or his deputie, & ſet to your handes or markes declaryng who was the owner of the clothe, and the kind and price therof, ſo helpe you God and by this booke.

AND it is alſo ordayned and enacted by thaucthoritie aforeſayd, that all kynde of clothes whiche from and after the feaſt of the Natiuitie of ſainct Ihon Baptiſt next commyng, duryng the ſpace of thre yeres then folowyng, ſhalbe made within this realme, or Wales, to be vttered and put to ſale, ſhalbe ſealed with the kynges ſeale, remainyng in the cuſtody of the Aulnageour, or his deputie, or deputies, and praiſed by two of the ſayd praiſers at the leaſt, and entred into the bokes hereafter in this act mencioned, vpon paine of forfayture of the ſame clothe, the one halfe to the kynges Maieſtie, the other to the partie that ſhall ſeaze the ſame.

AND it is alſo enacted by thaucthoritie aforeſayd, that there ſhalbe it. bookes yerely made, of the appraiſyng of all and euery kynde of clothe to be made duryng the ſayd .iii. yeres, thone of which bokes to remaine with the Aulnageour or his deputie, wherin ſhalbe written the colour, kynde and price of all and ſynguler clothes viewed and apprayſed that yere, accordyng to the tenor of this ſtatute, vnto whiche boke, the owner of euery cloth or ſome other perſon for him, and the praiſours, ſhal ſet to their handes or markes when the clothe is ſealed: And the other booke ſhal remayne with the owner of the ſayd clothe whervnto the ſayd Aulnageour and prayſours ſhal ſet their handes and markes. And that the owner of all and euery cloth chargeable to the payment of the Relief of clothes graunted by this acte, yerely within xx. dayes after the yere expired, ſhal deliuer his ſayd booke ſo ſubſcribed or marked with the handes of the Aulnageour or his deputie and prayſours to the Commiſſiooners for the taxacion and aſſeſment of the ſayd Relief within the limitte where ſuche clothier dwelleth, or to one of them, vpon payn of forfayture by the ſame clothier of treble ſo muche as he ought to pay to the kyng by reaſon of the aforeſayd Relief of his clothes ſo ſealed.

AND it is further ordayned and enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd,
that euery Aulnageour ſhall yerely frō & after the ſayd feaſt of the Natitutie of ſaint Ihon Baptiſt next commyng, kepe a parſite booke of the colour, kynd, and price of all and ſinguler clothes by him ſealed, and the names of the owners therof in maner and fourme as is before declared, and theſame booke yerely ſhal make and deliuer to the Commiſſioners, for the taxacion of goodes within the limites wher ſuche Clothe maker dwelleth, or to one of them, within xx. dayes next after the yere expired.

AND it is further ordayned and enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that if any Aulnageour or his deputie do not make and deliuer theſayd booke in maner and forme before reherſed, or do wylfully conceale any clothe by him ſealed, & do not entre it into the ſayd booke, that for ſuche offence the ſayd Aulnageour ſhal not onely forfayte his office, but alſo ſhal make fyne at the kynges will.

AND it is alſo ordayned and enacted by thaucthoritie aforeſayd, that the ſayd Cōmiſſioners of that limitte hauyng receiued the ſayd bookes of the Aulnageour or his deputie or deputies, and the owner of the clothes, ſhal conferre the rates of the Relief of the clothes▪ comprehended in the ſayd bookes, with the taxacion and payment of the owner of the ſame clothes for his goodes. So that if it ſhal appeare thereby to them that the owner of any cloth is chargeable to pay for his clothes, whiche before was not chargeable for his goodes, or that ſuche owner ought to paye more after the rate of the Relief of his clothes containyng in the bookes deliuered to theim, then he was before charged for the value of his ſubſtaunce of his goodes, the ſayd Commiſſioners as they be deuided ſhal within one moneth next after the ſayd bookes receiued, by their writyng indented to be ſigned and ſealed by them, make furth extreates of al & ſinguler ſummes of money that any perſon ought to pay for his clothes, not beeyng before charged with his goodes & for the ouerplus that any ſuche perſon ought to pay for that the rate of the clothes doeth ſurmount the payment of the value of his goodes before made: and the ſame writyng ſhal deliuer to the high Collectour of theſame limitte, to charge him with the receipt hereof, of the maker of the ſayd clothes: and the payment therof at the kynges receipte. And that the ſayd high Collectour ſhal haue the like power & aucthoritie to gather & leuy theſame, by ſuche like wayes and meanes as before in this acte bee limitted and appointed to the Subcollectour for the leuiyng and gatheryng of the Relief of goodes.

AND it is further ordayned and enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that the ſayd Commiſſioners ſhall yerely duryng the ſayd thre yeres make returne and certificat into the kinges Exchequier before the tenth daye of October, not only of the counterpane of all and euery extreate
deliuered by him to the high Collectour, but alſo of the booke receiued of the Aulnageour as is aforeſayd, and the praiſours names, and of all and ſinguler their procedynges cōceruyng the ſayd payment of the Relief of clothes.

And it is further ordayned and enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that euery of the ſayd high Collectours whiche ſhall accompt for any part of the ſayd Relief of clothes in the kynges Exchequier, vpon their ſeuerall ſayd accōptes to be yelden, ſhalbe alowed yerely duryng ye ſayd thre yeres, for euery pound limitted to his Collection, wherof any ſuche Collectour ſhalbe charged and yelde accompte, vi. d. as parcell of their ſayd charge, that is to ſay, ii. d. of euery pound thereof for ſuche perſons as bee limitted to be prayſours, for their paynes and labours: and other ii. d. of euery pound therof, euery of the ſayd chiefe Collectours there accomptant, to receiue to their owne vſe for their labours and charge in & aboute the premiſſes: and ii. d. of euery pounde reſidue to be deliuered, allowed and payed by the ſayd Collectours, ſo beeyng thereof allowed, to ſuche of the Commiſſioners as ſhal take vpon theim the buſynes and labour for & about the premiſſes, that is to ſay, euery Collectour to pay that Commiſſioner or Commiſſioners whiche had the orderyng and the writynges of and for the ſayd Relief of clothes where the ſayd Collector or Collectours had their colleccion, for expences of the ſayd Commiſſioners ſo takyng vpon them the ſayd buſynes and labour of their clerkes writyng the ſayd preceptes and eſtretes for the ſayd colleccions: the ſame laſt ii. d. of euery pound to bee deuided among the ſayd Commiſſioners, hauyng regard to the labour and buſynes taken by them and their ſayd clearkes in and aboute the premiſſes. For whiche parte ſo to the ſayd commiſſioners attainyng, the ſayd cōmiſſioners vi. v. iiii. iii. or as many of them as ſhalbe therto appointed by the kynges commiſſion and euery of them ioyntly and ſeuerally for his or their ſayd part may haue his remedy againſt the ſayd Collectour or Collectours whiche thereof been and might haue been allowed by accion of debt, in whiche the defendant ſhall not wage his lawe, neither proteccion, Iniunccion or other eſſoyne ſhalbe allowed.

Prouided alwayes, that this graunt of Relief nor any other thyng therin contayned, do in any wyſe extend to charge the inhabitauntes or dwellers within Ireland, Bulleyne and the countie of theſame, Calleys, Hammes, Guyſnes and the Marches of theſame, Ierneſey and Garneſey or any of them, of for or cōcernyng any goodes whiche the ſaid inhabitauntes or dwellers, or any other to their vſe haue within Irelande, Bulleyne, the countie of the ſame, Calleys, Hammes, Guyſnes, or other Marches of theſame, Ierneſey, Garneſey, ar in any of them.

Prouided alſo, that the ſayd graunt of Relief do not in any maner of wiſe extend or be preiudicial or hurtful to thinhabitaūtes or reſiauntes
at this preſent tyme within the fiue Portes corporate, or to any of their membres incorporate or vnited to the ſame fiue Portes, or to any of the ſame fiue Portes, of or for any part or parcel of the ſayd ſummes graū ted in this preſent Parliament of the ſayd inhabitauntes now reſiaūtes or any of them to bee taxed, ſet, aſked, leuied or payed, but that the ſayd inhabitauntes and now reſiauntes of the ſayd Portes & their membres and euery of them, bee and ſhalbe of and frō the ſayd graunt & payment of the ſayd Relief of their goodes and cattalles duryng their reſiauncie there and no lenger acquited and diſcharged, any matter or whatſoeuer thyng in this preſent acte made or had to the contrary notwithſtādyng.

Prouided alſo that this preſēt act of Relief, ne any other thing therin cōtayned extend to any of the Engliſh inhabitaūtes or reſiaūtes in any of the coūties of Northūberland, Cumberlād, Weſtmerland, the toune of Barwyke, the toune of Newcaſtle vpō Tyne and the biſhopricke of Durham, nor to any of them, of for or cōcernyng any goodes, clothes or ſhcepe, whiche the ſame inhabitauntes or dwellers or any other to their vſe, haue within the ſayd counties of Northumberland, Cumberland, and Weſtmerlād or the toune of Barwike, the toune of Newcaſtle vpō Tyne, or the biſhopricke of Durham or any of theim, but that they and euery of them, ſhalbe of & from the ſayd Relief, of and for their goodes, liyng and beyng in the ſame coūties, tounes & biſhopricke or any of thē, vtterly acquited and diſcharged, any thing in this preſent act before reherſed to the contrary notwithſtandyng.

Prouided alſo that this act ne any thyng therein contained ſhall extēd to the goodes of any College, Hall, or Oſtle within the vniuerſities of Oxford & Cambryge or any of them, or to the goodes of the College of Wynton. founded by biſhop Wykham, or to the goodes of ye College of Eton next Wyndeſore, or to the goodes of any reader or ſcholer with in the ſayd Vniuerſities and Colleges, or any of them there remainyng for ſtudye, without fraude or couyn, any thyng in this act contayned to the contrary in any wyſe notwithſtandyng.

Prouided alwayes and be it enacted by thaucthoritie aforeſayd that no ſpiritual perſon ſhalbe charged by this act for any of his goodes or cattalles, other then for ſheepe, nor ſhalbe charged by this acte for any ſuche his ſhepe whiche he hath, or at any tyme within thre yeres next folowyng ſhal haue or kepe for the only purpoſe to be ſpēt or eaten in his houſe, ſo as the nombre of the ſame ſhepe ſo purpoſed to be ſpent & eaten yerely in his ſayd houſe, do not excede the nombre of foure hundreth ſhepe for one yere, nor for any ſuche his ſhepe as do go and fede, or ſhall go or feede for the moſt part of euery yere of iii. yeres next cōmyng vpō his landes, tenementes or conunons, whereof ſuche ſpiritual perſone is or ſhalbe ſeazed in the right of his churche or promocion ſpiritual, whiche lādes, tenementes or commons be chargeable to the payment of the firſt fruites and tentes.

And foraſmuche as diuers and ſondry the kynges Maieſties tenaſites and other thinhabitauntes and dwellers within the coūties of Penbroke, Carmarthen, Cardygan, Glamorgan, Breknock, Radnor, Moūtgomery, Denbigh, Flynt, Marioneth, Angleſey, Carneruon and of the countie Palentine of Cheſter, be at this preſent tyme charged & chargeable with the ſeuerall paymentes of diuers great ſummes of money (by the name of a Myſc) due to his Maieſtie, according to the ſeueral cuſtomes of the ſayd coūtres, for the payment wherof diuers and ſondry the gentlemen and other the inhabitantes of the ſayd counties be and ſtand bound to his highnes: The kyng our ſoueraigne lorde is therfore pleaſed and contented that it be prouided, ordained & enacted by the aucthoritie aforeſayd, that this act or any thing therin cōtained, ſhal not extend to charge any of the kynges Maieſties tenauntes & other thinhabitātes and dwellers within any of the ſayd coūties of Penbroke, Carmarthen, Cardygan, Glamorgan, Brecknock, Radnor, Moūtgomery, Denbigh, Flynt, Marioneth, Angleſey, Carnaruon and the countie Palentine of Cheſter beyng charged or chargeable with the ſayd Myſe for or with any of the paymentes of the ſayd Relief graūted to ye kinges Maieſtie by this acte, vntill the ſeuerall dayes and tymes appointed and agreed for the paimentes of the ſayd Myſes ſhalbe expired. And that the firſt payment of the ſayd relief for goodes ſhalbe made at the receipt of ye kinges Exchequier before the firſt day of Maye then nexte folowyng after the day appointed for the later payment to bee made of the ſayd Myſe, and ſo yerely before the firſt day of May at the receipt of ye ſayd Exchequer vntil the thre ſeueral paymētes of the ſayd Relief be fully made in ſuche and like maner, forme and ordre as is ordayned and appointed by this act for the kynges ſubiectes concernyng the ſayd Relief of goodes to be made at the receipt of the ſayd Exchequer, accordyng to the tenor of this preſent act. And alſo that the fyrſt paymentes of Relief for clothes and ſhepe in euery of the ſayd ſeueral Counties ſhalbe made in the ſayd Exchequer after the ſayd Miſes, due to bee payde, at ſuche and like dayes & tymes yetely as is afore limited by this acte: this act or any thing therin contayned to the contrary in any wiſe notwithſtandyng.

And furthermore, be it enacted by aucthoritie aforeſayd that the tenauntes and dwellers of euery of the ſayd counties in this prouiſo remembred, ſhall ſeuerally before the feaſt of ſainct Martyne the biſhop next enſuyng, certifie in the kynges ſayd Court of Exchequer vnder the ſeale of two Iuſtices of peace of euery of the ſayd counties, whereof one to be of the Quorum, when and as what day the laſt payment of the ſayd ſeueral Myſes in euery of the ſayd counties ſhal ende and expire.
